text.headline: History of Artificial Intelligence
text.text: Explore the key events in the history of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and its evolution from concept to a transformative technology.

media.caption: Alan Turing at work on the German Enigma machine during World War II.

text.headline: Alan Turing's Contributions
text.text: Alan Turing, a British mathematician and logician, plays a crucial role in AI's foundation with his work on the Enigma machine and the concept of a universal machine that could simulate any other machine.

text.headline: Dartmouth Workshop
text.text: The term 'Artificial Intelligence' is coined by John McCarthy at the Dartmouth Workshop, marking the birth of AI as a field of study.

text.headline: Early AI Research
text.text: The 1950s and 1960s witness significant AI research, including the development of symbolic AI systems and early natural language processing experiments.

media.caption: ASIMO, a humanoid robot by Honda

text.headline: AI in Robotics
text.text: Rapid advancements in robotics, like Honda's ASIMO, showcase AI's impact on the development of intelligent machines capable of complex tasks.

text.headline: IBM's Watson
text.text: IBM's Watson wins the Jeopardy! quiz show, showcasing AI's natural language processing capabilities and its potential in various industries.

text.headline: AlphaGo's Triumph
text.text: Google's AlphaGo defeats world champion Go player Lee Sedol, demonstrating AI's ability to master complex, strategic games.

text.headline: Deep Learning Advancements
text.text: Deep learning, a subset of AI, gains prominence with breakthroughs in neural networks, leading to significant advances in machine learning.

text.headline: Rise of Neural Networks
text.text: Neural networks, inspired by the human brain, become a fundamental technology behind AI's success, particularly in deep learning and image recognition.

text.headline: AlphaZero's Chess Mastery
text.text: AlphaZero, developed by DeepMind, achieves superhuman performance in chess through reinforcement learning, further illustrating AI's capabilities.

text.headline: Deep Blue vs. Kasparov
text.text: IBM's Deep Blue defeats world chess champion Garry Kasparov, marking a historic moment in AI's journey to surpass human performance in specific domains.

text.headline: AlphaFold's Protein Folding Breakthrough
text.text: DeepMind's AlphaFold revolutionizes biology and medicine by predicting protein structures with exceptional accuracy, a major scientific advancement.

text.headline: GPT-3's Language Models
text.text: OpenAI's GPT-3 showcases the power of large-scale language models, with applications in natural language understanding, generation, and conversation.

text.headline: AI in Healthcare
text.text: AI, particularly DeepMind's algorithms, plays an essential role in healthcare, aiding in medical diagnoses, drug discovery, and patient care.
